chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
z: nat
y: nat
x: nat

Goal:
x ≲ y -> y ≲ z -> x ≲ z

Premises:
binary_le_le : forall x y : nat, x ≲ y -> x <= y
binary_le_lb_mask : forall x y : nat, x ≲ y -> ⟬ x ⟭ ⪯ ⟬ y ⟭
binary_le_eq_lb_mask : forall x y : nat, x ≲ y < -> ⟬ x ⟭ ⪯ ⟬ y ⟭
binary_le_refl : forall x : nat, x ≲ x
Inductive binary_le : nat -> nat -> Prop := in_ble_0 : forall n : nat, 0 ≲ n | in_ble_1 : forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> n ≲ m Arguments binary_le (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments in_ble_0 _%nat_scope Arguments in_ble_1 (_ _)%nat_scope
Record almost_ring_theory (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) : Prop := mk_art { ARadd_0_l : forall x : R, req (radd rO x) x; ARadd_comm : forall x y : R, req (radd x y) (radd y x); ARadd_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (radd x (radd y z)) (radd (radd x y) z); ARmul_1_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rI x) x; ARmul_0_l : forall x : R, req (rmul rO x) rO; ARmul_comm : forall x y : R, req (rmul x y) (rmul y x); ARmul_assoc : forall x y z : R, req (rmul x (rmul y z)) (rmul (rmul x y...
Record monoid_theory (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) : Prop := mk_monoid { monoid_unit_l : forall x : X, m u x = x; monoid_unit_r : forall x : X, m x u = x; monoid_assoc : forall x y z : X, m x (m y z) = m (m x y) z } Arguments monoid_theory [X]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments mk_monoid [X]%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _ _)%function_scope
VectorDef.map2 : (?A -> ?B -> ?C) -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t ?A n -> VectorDef.t ?B n -> VectorDef.t ?C n where ?A : [x : nat y : nat z : nat |- Type] ?B : [x : nat y : nat z : nat |- Type] ?C : [x : nat y : nat z : nat |- Type]
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
in_ble_1 : forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> n ≲ m
modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
binary_le_ind : forall P : nat -> nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P 0 n) -> (forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> P (div n 2) (div m 2) -> P n m) -> forall n n0 : nat, n ≲ n0 -> P n n0
binary_le_sind : forall P : nat -> nat -> SProp, (forall n : nat, P 0 n) -> (forall n m : nat, rem n 2 <= rem m 2 -> div n 2 ≲ div m 2 -> P (div n 2) (div m 2) -> P n m) -> forall n n0 : nat, n ≲ n0 -> P n n0
Nat.div_mod : forall x y : nat, y <> 0 -> x = y * (x / y) + x mod y
in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
binary_le_inv : forall n m : nat, n ≲ m -> n = 0 \/ div n 2 ≲ div m 2 /\ rem n 2 <= rem m 2
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
mscal_comm : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> m (mscal m u n x) y = m y (mscal m u n x)
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric = lb_mask_equiv_sym : Symmetric lb_mask_equiv Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y -> y ⪯ x /\ x ⪯ y Arguments lb_mask_equiv_rst_Symmetric [x y]
prime.base_p_uniq : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> forall l1 l2 : list nat, Forall2 (fun x y : nat => x < p /\ y < p) l1 l2 -> prime.expand p l1 = prime.expand p l2 -> l1 = l2
binary_le_zero_inv : forall n : nat, n ≲ 0 -> n = 0
mscal_sum : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (x y : X), m x y = m y x -> mscal m u n (m x y) = m (mscal m u n x) (mscal m u n y)
induction_ltof1 : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> nat) (P : A -> Type), (forall x : A, (forall y : A, ltof A f y x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall a : A, P a
lb_mask_binary_le : forall l m : lb, l ⪯ m -> ⟦ l ⟧ ≲ ⟦ m ⟧
IDmorph : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Equivalence req -> forall reqb : R -> R -> bool, (forall x y : R, reqb x y = ⟙ -> req x y) -> ring_morph rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp reqb (IDphi (R:=R))
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Record ring_morph (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop) (C : Type) (cO cI : C) (cadd cmul csub : C -> C -> C) (copp : C -> C) (ceqb : C -> C -> bool) (phi : C -> R) : Prop := mkmorph { morph0 : req (phi cO) rO; morph1 : req (phi cI) rI; morph_add : forall x y : C, req (phi (cadd x y)) (radd (phi x) (phi y)); morph_sub : forall x y : C, req (phi (csub x y)) (rsub (phi x) (phi y)); morph_mul : forall x y : C, req (phi (cmul x y)) (rmul (phi x) (phi y)); morph_opp : forall x : C,...
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
